title: Business demands EU trade deal as export optimism sinks to 18-year low
text:
Business leaders stepped up the pressure on ministers to strike an “ambitious” tariff-free trade deal with the European Union as optimism among manufacturers over exports sunk to its lowest level in 18 years.

The CBI’s latest industrial survey - taken before Boris Johnson struck a new Brexit deal in Brussels - comes as the PM’s withdrawal agreement faces an uncertain path through the House of Commons.

The data found plunging business optimism over export performance in the year ahead, with firms expecting weaker sales outweighing those expecting growth by 46pc - the worst result since October 2001 in the aftermath of the September 11 attacks on New York.
